title: Indonesia president signals intention to go after illegal mines
body: Indonesia will move to “rectify” illegal mines estimated to have caused $19 billion in state losses.

title: Nickel surpasses coal as Indonesia’s top export, Macquarie says
body: Earnings from overseas sales of nickel products were $16.5 billion in the first half of the year.

title: Indonesia discussing strategic management of critical minerals trade

title: Indonesia mining ministry proposes 18 development projects for Danantara funding
body: Danantara is Indonesian President Prabowo Subianto's main vehicle to achieve his 8% economic growth target by 2029.

title: Vale Indonesia to seek up to $1.2 billion financing in 2026-2027
body: The first round of financing, around $500 million, will likely come from bank loans in early 2026.

title: Indonesia looking at coal export levy to boost state coffers

title: Philippine miner sees surge in nickel shipments to Indonesia
body: Exports from the Philippines to Indonesia will likely rise to between 5 million and 10 million tons this year from around a million tons at the end of 2023.

title: Chinese tycoons are turning Indonesia into an aluminum giant
body: This year alone, three new alumina refineries, a key part of the aluminum production process, will begin working.

title: Indonesian minister seeks support to allow Amman to export copper concentrate
body: Amman said in February that it had around 200,000 metric tons of concentrate inventory available for export.

title: APNI's Training to Miners 2025 Forum Educates Nickel Industry Players on Regulations and Best Practices
body: The Training to Miners (TTM) 2025 forum, organized by the Indonesian Nickel Miners Association (APNI), aimed to educate nickel industry players on regulations, government policies, and current challenges in the mining sector. The three-day event featured speakers from the government, academia, and industry practitioners, providing a platform for discussion and knowledge sharing.

title: APNI Successfully Holds 7th Training to Miners (TTM) 2025
body: The Indonesian Nickel Miners Association (APNI) held its 7th Training to Miners (TTM) 2025, a three-day event aimed at enhancing the capacity and understanding of nickel industry players in various strategic aspects of mining. The training covered nine key topics, including RKAB 1 Year, minimum wage policy, ESG integration, and Indonesia Metals Exchange, and was attended by government representatives, academia, and industry players.

title: Indonesian President Vows to Crack Down on Illegal Mining, Targets Elite and Officials
body: President Prabowo Subianto has pledged to tackle illegal mining, which has caused the state a loss of at least IDR 300 trillion, and warned that no one, including elite and officials, will be protected from the law. The government plans to establish cooperatives to legalize small-scale mining and create millions of quality jobs through investment and downstreaming of natural resources.

title: Indonesia's Nickel Reference Price Falls Slightly in Second Half of August 2025
body: The Indonesian government has set the nickel reference price at US$15.012,67 per dry metric ton for the second half of August 2025, a slight decrease from the previous period. The fluctuation in prices serves as a signal for nickel industry players to adjust their production and marketing strategies, considering the reference price is a key factor in domestic transactions and royalty calculations.

title: Indonesia Pushes for Nickel Hilirisasi to Boost Industry Competitiveness and Attract Investment
body: The Indonesian government is emphasizing the importance of nickel hilirisasi to increase industry competitiveness and attract investment, with 18 strategic projects worth Rp500 trillion in potential investment. The government is also strengthening environmental, social, and governance (ESG) implementation in the mining sector through revised regulations and certification standards.

title: Indonesian Nickel Miners Association Supports Development of Sustainability Certification
body: The Indonesian Nickel Miners Association (APNI) has expressed its readiness to support the development of sustainability certification in the mining sector to strengthen environmental, social, and governance (ESG) practices and expand access to international markets. APNI has been in discussions with global automotive producers, such as Tesla and Mercedes-Benz, to ensure that Indonesian nickel meets international ESG standards.

title: Aquila Nickel Group Implements Regulatory Compliance System to Strengthen Governance in Nickel Mining
body: PT Bumi Konawe Minerina, a subsidiary of Aquila Nickel Group, has implemented a Regulatory Compliance System (RCS) to enhance legal compliance and governance in the nickel mining industry. The system aims to ensure timely and structured management of legal obligations, supporting the company's commitment to responsible and transparent mining practices.

title: Indonesian Nickel Industry Leaders Discuss Challenges and Strategies for Resilience
body: Indonesian nickel industry leaders discussed the challenges of low nickel prices, global uncertainty, and the importance of sustainable investment at the 4th Nickel Producers, Processors, and Buyers Conference in Jakarta. They emphasized the need for realistic market expectations, diversification of products and markets, and responsible mining practices to ensure the long-term sustainability of the industry.

title: SESNA Develops Renewable Energy Solutions for Nickel Smelters in Indonesia
body: PT Sumber Energi Surya Nusantara (SESNA) is building a 300 MWp solar power plant to support decarbonization of nickel smelters in Indonesia, particularly in the Morowali industrial area. The project aims to reduce carbon emissions and meet global sustainability standards, with a target to start construction in September 2025.

title: Indonesia's Mining Sector Contributes Rp74.2 Trillion to State Revenue in H1 2025
body: Indonesia's mining sector, led by nickel, contributed Rp74.2 trillion to state revenue in the first half of 2025, with the sector's overall revenue reaching Rp138.8 trillion, or 54.5% of the annual target. The government is optimistic that the target of Rp254.5 trillion can be achieved by the end of the year, driven by stable commodity prices and increased national production volume.

title: Pertamina NRE Boosts Renewable Energy Capacity, Sees 14% Increase in H1 2025
body: Pertamina New & Renewable Energy (Pertamina NRE) has increased its renewable energy capacity by 14% to 2,842 MW in the first half of 2025, driven by its strategic acquisition of 20% stake in Citicore Renewable Energy Corporation (CREC). CREC's revenue grew 28% to ₱2.66 billion, with EBITDA rising 22% to ₱932 million and net profit jumping 38% to ₱630 million.

title: Pertamina NRE's Investment in CREC Boosts Stock Price by 30%
body: Pertamina NRE's investment in CREC on June 18 was positively received by the Philippine stock market, with CREC's stock price increasing by 30% to ₱4.21 (around Rp 1,195 per share) as of August 15. The investment has boosted investor confidence in CREC, reflected in the steady rise in its stock price since the start of 2025.

title: Zulfan Zahar Elected as New Chairman of Masyarakat Energi Terbarukan Indonesia (METI)
body: Zulfan Zahar has been elected as the new Chairman of Masyarakat Energi Terbarukan Indonesia (METI) for the 2025-2028 period, securing 84.9% of the votes. The new leadership is expected to focus on developing human resources and promoting transparency in the renewable energy sector to support Indonesia's national energy transition goals.

title: Indonesia's Electric Vehicle Industry Enters New Phase, Emphasizing Battery Safety and Certification
body: PT CARSURIN Tbk, a leading battery testing laboratory operator in Indonesia, warns the electric vehicle industry to prioritize battery safety and certification, citing the decline in electric motorcycle sales after subsidy quotas ended in 2024. The company emphasizes that investing in battery testing is crucial for long-term growth and reputation, rather than just meeting short-term regulatory requirements.

title: Indonesia's Carbon Economic Value: A Strategic Instrument for Industrial Transition
body: The implementation of Carbon Economic Value (NEK) in Indonesia is expected to increase energy efficiency, promote the adoption of green technology, and prepare industries for international climate policies. The policy will also have a significant impact on small and medium-sized enterprises (IKM) in the industrial supply chain, encouraging them to adopt low-carbon technologies and reduce their carbon footprint.

title: PLN Commits to Promoting Science and Technology for Renewable Energy Development in Indonesia
body: PT PLN (Persero) is committed to promoting the use of science and technology to increase the portion of new and renewable energy (EBT) in Indonesia, supporting energy self-sufficiency and national economic growth. The company is ready to collaborate with universities and research institutions to implement research results in accelerating the use of EBT in Indonesia.

title: Pertamina Develops Bioethanol from Aren Trees to Support National Energy Transition
body: PT Pertamina is preparing a strategic plan to develop renewable energy through the use of aren trees as a raw material for bioethanol, with a pilot project planned in several regions in Indonesia, aiming to produce 876,000 kiloliters of bioethanol per year. This initiative is expected to become a game-changer in the national energy transition and support the country's Net Zero Emission 2060 target.

title: PT Timah Supports Mapur Cultural Heritage through TJSL Program
body: PT Timah Tbk has launched a Tanggung Jawab Sosial dan Lingkungan (TJSL) program to preserve Mapur cultural heritage, building a traditional village, Kampung Adat Gebong Memarong, in Bangka Belitung, which has boosted the local economy and attracted tourists. The program has also provided training for local residents to become tour guides, with 2,000 tourists visiting the village every month.

title: MIND ID Develops Kalium Humat Product from Low-Calorie Coal, Boosting Agricultural Productivity by 30%
body: MIND ID, through its subsidiary PT Bukit Asam Tbk, has developed a kalium humat product from low-calorie coal, which can increase agricultural productivity by 30%. The product, resulting from a collaboration with Universitas Gadjah Mada, has a production capacity of 144 tons per year and is expected to support the government's national food self-sufficiency program.

title: Bangka Belitung to Host Indonesia's Largest Tin Smelter with $1.5-2 Billion Investment
body: The province of Bangka Belitung is set to host Indonesia's largest tin smelter with an investment of Rp1.5-2 trillion (approximately $1.5-2 billion) by PT Tong Fang, a Chinese investor, which is expected to produce 300 tons of high-value tin products per month. The smelter will create jobs for around 70% of the local workforce and is expected to start operating within a year.

title: ITB and IAFMI Sign MoU to Strengthen Collaboration in Oil and Gas Industry
body: Institut Teknologi Bandung (ITB) and Ikatan Ahli Fasilitas Produksi Minyak dan Gas Bumi Indonesia (IAFMI) signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) to enhance collaborative research and development in the oil and gas industry. The partnership aims to promote innovation, increase national capacity, and address global energy challenges.

title: Pertamina Drilling Successfully Completes Sembakung Deep-01 Exploration Well in Nunukan, Kalimantan Utara
body: Pertamina Drilling's Rig PDSI#43.3/AB1500-E successfully completed the Sembakung Deep-01 exploration well, reaching a depth of over 2,100 meters and discovering new gas reserves with low CO₂ content. The well's production test on August 4, 2025, showed a promising gas flow, marking a significant achievement for Pertamina Drilling and opening up new opportunities for energy exploration in Kalimantan.

title: Indonesia's Energy and Mineral Resources Sector: A Key Driver of National Development
body: As Indonesia celebrates its 80th anniversary, the energy and mineral resources sector reaffirms its strategic role in driving national development, with a focus on energy transition, national energy resilience, and sustainable exploration and production. The sector's future direction will be shaped by key decisions on new work areas, fiscal policy revisions, energy integration with industry, and large-scale energy infrastructure development.

title: Indonesia's Mining Sector Struggles with Investment Uncertainty
body: Indonesia's rich natural resources, particularly in the energy and mineral sectors, have the potential to attract significant investment and drive economic growth, but uncertainty and insecurity are deterring investors, leading to a decline in production and revenue. To address this, the government needs to create a conducive investment climate by simplifying and stabilizing regulations, ensuring fair and transparent law enforcement, and providing investment protection.

title: Pertamina NRE's Investment in CREC Boosts Stock Price by 30%
body: Pertamina NRE's investment in CREC on June 18 was positively received by the Philippine stock market, with CREC's stock price increasing by 30% to ₱4.21 (around Rp 1,195 per share) since the start of 2025. The investment has led to a significant surge in CREC's stock value, reflecting market confidence in the partnership.
